results.title: Sunstruck
results.creator_credit: James Gilbert, Jack Neary, James Grafton and Immigrant (AU)
results.brief_description: After responding to a New South Wales government advertisement designed to attract teachers from Britain, a shy teacher from Wales is assigned to a one-teacher school in the isolated bush town of Kookaburra Springs. Initially he has problems adjusting to his new life as he struggles to gain respect from his students. Despite resistance he forms a school choir, which travels Sydney to participate in a singing competition. The trip is a success and on their return to Kookaburra Springs he decides to stay on in the town and marry. Primarily a vehicle for British singer and comedian Harry Secombe, the film was shot on location near the New South Wales town of Parkes with a budget of under $400,000. Cast also includes Maggie Fitzgibbon, John Meillon, Peter Whittle, Dawn Lake, Bobby Limb.

results.title: The Winds of Jarrah
results.creator_credit: Marj Pearson, Mark Egerton and Film Corporation of Western Australia
results.brief_description: Based on a Harlequin/Mills and Boon novel “The house in the timberwoods” by Joyce Dingwell. Set in Australia in 1946, it is the story of an English governess employed by the wealthy boss of a timber empire. He and his three children harbour a deep mistrust of women and she is befriended by one of the many returned servicemen in the timberlands. Stars Terence Donovan and Susan Lyons, supported by Harold Hopkins, Steve Bisley and Martin Vaughan.

results.title: The Mosquito coast
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir, Jerome Hellman and Saul Zaentz
results.brief_description: Based on the novel of the same name by Paul Theroux and adapted for the screen by Paul Schrader, the film tells the story of an eccentric inventor who, sick of seeing the world deteriorate around him, takes his family from their Massachusetts farm to the dark jungles of Honduras to start a fresh new life. However all does not run smoothly in their new jungle paradise and it is not the utopia of his dreams. Stars Harrison Ford, River Phoenix, Helen Mirren and Martha Plimpton.

results.title: Cocktail
results.creator_credit: Roger Donaldson, Robert W. Court, Ted Field, Interscope, Silver Screen Partners and Touchstone
results.brief_description: When a young confident and ambitious bartender moves to Jamaica he meets an artist and their romance brings a new perspective to his self-centred life. Stars Tom Cruise and Bryan Brown.

results.title: Tender mercies
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Horton Foote, Robert Duvall, Antron Media and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description: A compassionate love story tracing the relationship between a burnt-out country and western star and a young widow he meets in a Texas motel. His past is littered with the spoils of fame and scarred by alcoholism, two broken marriages and a painful descent from stardom so that he lacks confidence in relationships and has a low opinion of himself and others. The widow and her young son help him to rebuild his life and to appreciate the healing power of affection. Stars Robert Duvall and Tess Harper.

results.title: Making 'The Girl from Tomorrow'
results.brief_description: The making of “The Girl from Tomorrow” provides teachers of media with an example of how this exciting series was made. Interviews with the director, Kathy Mueller and the producer, Noel Price are included along with technical information on just how the special effects were achieved.

results.title: Singapore: Crossroads of Asia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Travel to exotic Singapore, the ancient trading port poised on the tip of the Malay peninsula that has become a 21st century commercial centre. Stroll across the Padang to admire Parliament House and the Singapore Cricket Club, visit the temple of Heavenly Happiness, Sultan Mosque and Raffles Hotel, home of the Singapore Sling. Shop on Orchard Road, play on Sentosa Island and cap your visit with a tour of Singapore by trishaw.

results.title: Japan: The Island Empire
results.creator_credit: Maureen Zrike, Christopher Zrike and International Video Network
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Japan begins to unfold as you enter a Zen temple, then witness an ancient ritual in a Shinto shrine. In the resort of Ibusuki, you will marvel at guests buried to the neck in steaming volcanic sand. Admire the great Buddha of Kamakura and the splendid architecture of 400 year old Himeji Castle. Then plunge into the frantic pace of Tokyo during the Sanja Matsuri Festival.

results.title: Scouts: the rise of the world scouting movement
results.creator_credit: Michael Dana Murphy and Clear Horizon Films
results.brief_description: Scouts is a celebration of the potential of youth that documents the triumphs and tragedies of the Scout ideal. Historic newsreels, rare archival film and scenes from Baden-Powell’s own home movies bring alive the era of Baden-Powell and the origins of Scouting. “Scouts” is a unique program that will captivate any audience, whether or not they have taken the Scout oath.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Dana Murphy and Clear Horizon Films

results.title: La Ronde
results.brief_description: An ironic narrator comperes Ophuls’ circular tale of love and seduction set in the nostalgic Vienna of 1900. “La Ronde” was booed at its premiere, but went on to become one of the greatest successes of post-war European cinema. Bans and protests againsts its ‘immorality’ only boosted its fame: in London it played for eighteen months at one cinema. With a superb cast, lavish production values and bravura camerawork, “La Ronde” confirms Ophuls’ reputation as one of the cinema’s major artists. Stars a veritable who’s who of European cinema including Anton Walbrook, Simone Signoret, Serge Reggiani, Simone Simon, Daniel Gelin, Danielle Darrieux, Fernand Gravey, Odette Joyeux, Jean-Louis Barrault, Isa Miranda and Gerard Philipe.
